00049 
00050 SCA_KeyboardSensor::SCA_KeyboardSensor(SCA_KeyboardManager* keybdmgr,
00051                                        short int hotkey,
00052                                        short int qual,
00053                                        short int qual2,
00054                                        bool bAllKeys,
00055                                        const STR_String& targetProp,
00056                                        const STR_String& toggleProp,
00057                                        SCA_IObject* gameobj)
00058     :SCA_ISensor(gameobj,keybdmgr),
00059      m_hotkey(hotkey),
00060      m_qual(qual),
00061      m_qual2(qual2),
00062      m_bAllKeys(bAllKeys),
00063      m_targetprop(targetProp),
00064      m_toggleprop(toggleProp)
00065 {
00066     if (hotkey == SCA_IInputDevice::KX_ESCKEY)
00067         keybdmgr->GetInputDevice()->HookEscape();
00068 //  SetDrawColor(0xff0000ff);
00069     Init();
00070 }

00077 
00078 void SCA_KeyboardSensor::Init()
00079 {
00080     // this function is used when the sensor is disconnected from all controllers
00081     // by the state engine. It reinitializes the sensor as if it was just created.
00082     // However, if the target key is pressed when the sensor is reactivated, it
00083     // will not generated an event (see remark in Evaluate()).
00084     m_val = (m_invert)?1:0;
00085     m_reset = true;
00086 }
00087 
00088 CValue* SCA_KeyboardSensor::GetReplica()
00089 {
00090     SCA_KeyboardSensor* replica = new SCA_KeyboardSensor(*this);
00091     // this will copy properties and so on...
00092     replica->ProcessReplica();
00093     replica->Init();
00094     return replica;
00095 }

00106 bool SCA_KeyboardSensor::IsPositiveTrigger()
00107 { 
00108     bool result = (m_val != 0);
00109 
00110     if (m_invert)
00111         result = !result;
00112         
00113     return result;
00114 }

00118 bool SCA_KeyboardSensor::TriggerOnAllKeys()
00119 { 
00120     return m_bAllKeys;

00124 
00125 bool SCA_KeyboardSensor::Evaluate()
00126 {
00127     bool result    = false;
00128     bool reset     = m_reset && m_level;
00129     bool qual      = true;
00130     bool qual_change = false;
00131     short int m_val_orig = m_val;
00132     
00133     SCA_IInputDevice* inputdev = ((SCA_KeyboardManager *)m_eventmgr)->GetInputDevice();
00134     //      cerr << "SCA_KeyboardSensor::Eval event, sensing for "<< m_hotkey << " at device " << inputdev << "\n";
00135 
00136     /* See if we need to do logging: togPropState exists and is
00137      * different from 0 */
00138     CValue* myparent = GetParent();
00139     CValue* togPropState = myparent->GetProperty(m_toggleprop);
00140     if (togPropState &&
00141         (((int)togPropState->GetNumber()) != 0) )
00142     {
00143         LogKeystrokes();
00144     }
00145 
00146     m_reset = false;
00147 
00148     /* Now see whether events must be bounced. */
00149     if (m_bAllKeys)
00150     {
00151         bool justactivated = false;
00152         bool justreleased = false;
00153         bool active = false;
00154 
00155         for (int i=SCA_IInputDevice::KX_BEGINKEY ; i<= SCA_IInputDevice::KX_ENDKEY;i++)
00156         {
00157             const SCA_InputEvent & inevent = inputdev->GetEventValue((SCA_IInputDevice::KX_EnumInputs) i);
00158             switch (inevent.m_status) 
00159             { 
00160             case SCA_InputEvent::KX_JUSTACTIVATED:
00161                 justactivated = true;
00162                 break;
00163             case SCA_InputEvent::KX_JUSTRELEASED:
00164                 justreleased = true;
00165                 break;
00166             case SCA_InputEvent::KX_ACTIVE:
00167                 active = true;
00168                 break;
00169             case SCA_InputEvent::KX_NO_INPUTSTATUS:
00170                 /* do nothing */
00171                 break;
00172             }
00173         }
00174 
00175         if (justactivated)
00176         {
00177             m_val=1;
00178             result = true;
00179         } else
00180         {
00181             if (justreleased)
00182             {
00183                 m_val=(active)?1:0;
00184                 result = true;
00185             } else
00186             {
00187                 if (active)
00188                 {
00189                     if (m_val == 0)
00190                     {
00191                         m_val = 1;
00192                         if (m_level) {
00193                             result = true;
00194                         }
00195                     }
00196                 } else
00197                 {
00198                     if (m_val == 1)
00199                     {
00200                         m_val = 0;
00201                         result = true;
00202                     }
00203                 }
00204             }
00205             if (m_tap)
00206                 // special case for tap mode: only generate event for new activation
00207                 result = false;
00208         }
00209 
00210 
00211     } else
00212     {
00213 
00214     //      cerr << "======= SCA_KeyboardSensor::Evaluate:: peeking at key status" << endl;
00215         const SCA_InputEvent & inevent = inputdev->GetEventValue(
00216             (SCA_IInputDevice::KX_EnumInputs) m_hotkey);
00217     
00218     //      cerr << "======= SCA_KeyboardSensor::Evaluate:: status: " << inevent.m_status << endl;
00219         
00220         
00221         /* Check qualifier keys
00222          * - see if the qualifiers we request are pressed - 'qual' true/false
00223          * - see if the qualifiers we request changed their state - 'qual_change' true/false
00224          */
00225         if (m_qual > 0) {
00226             const SCA_InputEvent & qualevent = inputdev->GetEventValue((SCA_IInputDevice::KX_EnumInputs) m_qual);
00227             switch(qualevent.m_status) {
00228             case SCA_InputEvent::KX_NO_INPUTSTATUS:
00229                 qual = false;
00230                 break;
00231             case SCA_InputEvent::KX_JUSTRELEASED:
00232                 qual_change = true;
00233                 qual = false;
00234                 break;
00235             case SCA_InputEvent::KX_JUSTACTIVATED:
00236                 qual_change = true;
00237             case SCA_InputEvent::KX_ACTIVE:
00238                 /* do nothing */
00239                 break;
00240             }
00241         }
00242         if (m_qual2 > 0 && qual==true) {
00243             const SCA_InputEvent & qualevent = inputdev->GetEventValue((SCA_IInputDevice::KX_EnumInputs) m_qual2);
00244             /* copy of above */
00245             switch(qualevent.m_status) {
00246             case SCA_InputEvent::KX_NO_INPUTSTATUS:
00247                 qual = false;
00248                 break;
00249             case SCA_InputEvent::KX_JUSTRELEASED:
00250                 qual_change = true;
00251                 qual = false;
00252                 break;
00253             case SCA_InputEvent::KX_JUSTACTIVATED:
00254                 qual_change = true;
00255             case SCA_InputEvent::KX_ACTIVE:
00256                 /* do nothing */
00257                 break;
00258             }
00259         }
00260         /* done reading qualifiers */
00261         
00262         if (inevent.m_status == SCA_InputEvent::KX_NO_INPUTSTATUS)
00263         {
00264             if (m_val == 1)
00265             {
00266                 // this situation may occur after a scene suspend: the keyboard release 
00267                 // event was not captured, produce now the event off
00268                 m_val = 0;
00269                 result = true;
00270             }
00271         } else
00272         {
00273             if (inevent.m_status == SCA_InputEvent::KX_JUSTACTIVATED)
00274             {
00275                 m_val=1;
00276                 result = true;
00277             } else
00278             {
00279                 if (inevent.m_status == SCA_InputEvent::KX_JUSTRELEASED)
00280                 {
00281                     m_val = 0;
00282                     result = true;
00283                 } else 
00284                 {
00285                     if (inevent.m_status == SCA_InputEvent::KX_ACTIVE)
00286                     {
00287                         if (m_val == 0)
00288                         {
00289                             m_val = 1;
00290                             if (m_level) 
00291                             {
00292                                 result = true;
00293                             }
00294                         }
00295                     }
00296                 }
00297             }
00298         }
00299         
00300         /* Modify the key state based on qual(s)
00301          * Tested carefully. don't touch unless your really sure.
00302          * note, this will only change the results if key modifiers are set.
00303          *
00304          * When all modifiers and keys are positive
00305          *  - pulse true
00306          * 
00307          * When ANY of the modifiers or main key become inactive,
00308          *  - pulse false
00309          */
00310         if (qual==false) { /* one of the qualifiers are not pressed */
00311             if (m_val_orig && qual_change) { /* we were originally enabled, but a qualifier changed */
00312                 result = true;
00313             } else {
00314                 result = false;
00315             }
00316             m_val = 0; /* since one of the qualifiers is not on, set the state to false */
00317         } else {                        /* we done have any qualifiers or they are all pressed */
00318             if (m_val && qual_change) { /* the main key state is true and our qualifier just changed */
00319                 result = true;
00320             }
00321         }
00322         /* done with key quals */
00323         
00324     }
00325     
00326     if (reset)
00327         // force an event
00328         result = true;
00329     return result;
00330 
00331 }
00332 
00333 void SCA_KeyboardSensor::AddToTargetProp(int keyIndex)
00334 {
00335     if (IsPrintable(keyIndex)) {
00336         CValue* tprop = GetParent()->GetProperty(m_targetprop);
00337         
00338         if (tprop) {
00339             /* overwrite the old property */
00340             if (IsDelete(keyIndex)) {
00341                 /* strip one char, if possible */
00342                 STR_String newprop = tprop->GetText();
00343                 int oldlength = newprop.Length();
00344                 if (oldlength >= 1 ) {
00345                     int newlength=oldlength;
00346 
00347                     BLI_str_cursor_step_prev_utf8(newprop, newprop.Length(), &newlength);
00348                     newprop.SetLength(newlength);
00349 
00350                     CStringValue * newstringprop = new CStringValue(newprop, m_targetprop);
00351                     GetParent()->SetProperty(m_targetprop, newstringprop);
00352                     newstringprop->Release();
00353                 }               
00354             } else {
00355                 /* append */
00356                 char pchar = ToCharacter(keyIndex, IsShifted());
00357                 STR_String newprop = tprop->GetText() + pchar;
00358                 CStringValue * newstringprop = new CStringValue(newprop, m_targetprop);         
00359                 GetParent()->SetProperty(m_targetprop, newstringprop);
00360                 newstringprop->Release();
00361             }
00362         } else {
00363             if (!IsDelete(keyIndex)) {
00364                 /* Make a new property. Deletes can be ignored. */
00365                 char pchar = ToCharacter(keyIndex, IsShifted());
00366                 STR_String newprop = pchar;
00367                 CStringValue * newstringprop = new CStringValue(newprop, m_targetprop);         
00368                 GetParent()->SetProperty(m_targetprop, newstringprop);
00369                 newstringprop->Release();
00370             }
00371         }
00372     }
00373     
00374 }
00375     
00379 bool SCA_KeyboardSensor::IsShifted(void)
00380 {
00381     SCA_IInputDevice* inputdev = ((SCA_KeyboardManager *)m_eventmgr)->GetInputDevice();
00382     
00383     if ( (inputdev->GetEventValue(SCA_IInputDevice::KX_RIGHTSHIFTKEY).m_status 
00384           == SCA_InputEvent::KX_ACTIVE)
00385          || (inputdev->GetEventValue(SCA_IInputDevice::KX_RIGHTSHIFTKEY).m_status 
00386              == SCA_InputEvent::KX_JUSTACTIVATED)
00387          || (inputdev->GetEventValue(SCA_IInputDevice::KX_LEFTSHIFTKEY).m_status 
00388              == SCA_InputEvent::KX_ACTIVE)
00389          || (inputdev->GetEventValue(SCA_IInputDevice::KX_LEFTSHIFTKEY).m_status 
00390              == SCA_InputEvent::KX_JUSTACTIVATED)
00391         ) {
00392         return true;
00393     } else {
00394         return false;
00395     }   
00396 }
00397 
00398 void SCA_KeyboardSensor::LogKeystrokes(void) 
00399 {
00400     SCA_IInputDevice* inputdev = ((SCA_KeyboardManager *)m_eventmgr)->GetInputDevice();
00401     int num = inputdev->GetNumActiveEvents();
00402 
00403     /* weird loop, this one... */
00404     if (num > 0)
00405     {
00406         
00407         int index = 0;
00408         /* Check on all keys whether they were pushed. This does not
00409          * untangle the ordering, so don't type too fast :) */
00410         for (int i=SCA_IInputDevice::KX_BEGINKEY ; i<= SCA_IInputDevice::KX_ENDKEY;i++)
00411         {
00412             const SCA_InputEvent & inevent = inputdev->GetEventValue((SCA_IInputDevice::KX_EnumInputs) i);
00413             if (inevent.m_status == SCA_InputEvent::KX_JUSTACTIVATED) //NO_INPUTSTATUS)
00414             {
00415                 if (index < num)
00416                 {
00417                     AddToTargetProp(i);
00418                     index++;
00419                 }
00420             }
00421         }
00422     }
00423 }

00431 KX_PYMETHODDEF_DOC_O(SCA_KeyboardSensor, getKeyStatus,
00432 "getKeyStatus(keycode)\n"
00433 "\tGet the given key's status (KX_NO_INPUTSTATUS, KX_JUSTACTIVATED, KX_ACTIVE or KX_JUSTRELEASED).\n")
00434 {
00435     if (!PyLong_Check(value)) {
00436         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError, "sensor.getKeyStatus(int): Keyboard Sensor, expected an int");
00437         return NULL;
00438     }
00439     
00440     int keycode = PyLong_AsSsize_t(value);
00441     
00442     if ((keycode < SCA_IInputDevice::KX_BEGINKEY)
00443         || (keycode > SCA_IInputDevice::KX_ENDKEY)) {
00444         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_AttributeError, "sensor.getKeyStatus(int): Keyboard Sensor, invalid keycode specified!");
00445         return NULL;
00446     }
00447     
00448     SCA_IInputDevice* inputdev = ((SCA_KeyboardManager *)m_eventmgr)->GetInputDevice();
00449     const SCA_InputEvent & inevent = inputdev->GetEventValue((SCA_IInputDevice::KX_EnumInputs) keycode);
00450     return PyLong_FromSsize_t(inevent.m_status);
00451 }

00484 PyAttributeDef SCA_KeyboardSensor::Attributes[] = {
00485     KX_PYATTRIBUTE_RO_FUNCTION("events", SCA_KeyboardSensor, pyattr_get_events),
00486     KX_PYATTRIBUTE_BOOL_RW("useAllKeys",SCA_KeyboardSensor,m_bAllKeys),
00487     KX_PYATTRIBUTE_INT_RW("key",0,SCA_IInputDevice::KX_ENDKEY,true,SCA_KeyboardSensor,m_hotkey),

00495 
00496 PyObject* SCA_KeyboardSensor::pyattr_get_events(void *self_v, const KX_PYATTRIBUTE_DEF *attrdef)
00497 {
00498     SCA_KeyboardSensor* self= static_cast<SCA_KeyboardSensor*>(self_v);
00499     
00500     SCA_IInputDevice* inputdev = ((SCA_KeyboardManager *)self->m_eventmgr)->GetInputDevice();
00501 
00502     PyObject* resultlist = PyList_New(0);
00503     
00504     for (int i=SCA_IInputDevice::KX_BEGINKEY ; i<= SCA_IInputDevice::KX_ENDKEY;i++)
00505     {
00506         const SCA_InputEvent & inevent = inputdev->GetEventValue((SCA_IInputDevice::KX_EnumInputs) i);
00507         if (inevent.m_status != SCA_InputEvent::KX_NO_INPUTSTATUS)
00508         {
00509             PyObject* keypair = PyList_New(2);
00510             PyList_SET_ITEM(keypair,0,PyLong_FromSsize_t(i));
00511             PyList_SET_ITEM(keypair,1,PyLong_FromSsize_t(inevent.m_status));
00512             PyList_Append(resultlist,keypair);
00513         }
00514     }   
00515     return resultlist;
00516 }

00520 /* Accessed from python */
00521 
00522 // this code looks ugly, please use an ordinary hashtable
00523 
00524 char ToCharacter(int keyIndex, bool shifted)
00525 {
00526     /* numerals */
00527     if ( (keyIndex >= SCA_IInputDevice::KX_ZEROKEY) 
00528          && (keyIndex <= SCA_IInputDevice::KX_NINEKEY) ) {
00529         if (shifted) {
00530             char numshift[] = ")!@#$%^&*(";
00531             return numshift[keyIndex - '0']; 
00532         } else {
00533             return keyIndex - SCA_IInputDevice::KX_ZEROKEY + '0'; 
00534         }
00535     }
00536     
00537     /* letters... always lowercase... is that desirable? */
00538     if ( (keyIndex >= SCA_IInputDevice::KX_AKEY) 
00539          && (keyIndex <= SCA_IInputDevice::KX_ZKEY) ) {
00540         if (shifted) {
00541             return keyIndex - SCA_IInputDevice::KX_AKEY + 'A'; 
00542         } else {
00543             return keyIndex - SCA_IInputDevice::KX_AKEY + 'a'; 
00544         }
00545     }
00546     
00547     if (keyIndex == SCA_IInputDevice::KX_SPACEKEY) {
00548         return ' ';
00549     }
00550     if (keyIndex == SCA_IInputDevice::KX_RETKEY || keyIndex == SCA_IInputDevice::KX_PADENTER) {
00551         return '\n';
00552     }
00553     
00554     
00555     if (keyIndex == SCA_IInputDevice::KX_PADASTERKEY) {
00556         return '*';
00557     }
00558     
00559     if (keyIndex == SCA_IInputDevice::KX_TABKEY) {
00560         return '\t';
00561     }
00562     
00563     /* comma to period */
00564     char commatoperiod[] = ",-.";
00565     char commatoperiodshifted[] = "<_>";
00566     if (keyIndex == SCA_IInputDevice::KX_COMMAKEY) {
00567         if (shifted) {
00568             return commatoperiodshifted[0];
00569         } else {
00570             return commatoperiod[0];
00571         }
00572     }
00573     if (keyIndex == SCA_IInputDevice::KX_MINUSKEY) {
00574         if (shifted) {
00575             return commatoperiodshifted[1];
00576         } else {
00577             return commatoperiod[1];
00578         }
00579     }
00580     if (keyIndex == SCA_IInputDevice::KX_PERIODKEY) {
00581         if (shifted) {
00582             return commatoperiodshifted[2];
00583         } else {
00584             return commatoperiod[2];
00585         }
00586     }
00587     
00588     /* semicolon to rightbracket */
00589     char semicolontorightbracket[] = ";\'`/\\=[]";
00590     char semicolontorightbracketshifted[] = ":\"~\?|+{}";
00591     if ((keyIndex >= SCA_IInputDevice::KX_SEMICOLONKEY) 
00592         && (keyIndex <= SCA_IInputDevice::KX_RIGHTBRACKETKEY)) {
00593         if (shifted) {
00594             return semicolontorightbracketshifted[keyIndex - SCA_IInputDevice::KX_SEMICOLONKEY];
00595         } else {
00596             return semicolontorightbracket[keyIndex - SCA_IInputDevice::KX_SEMICOLONKEY];
00597         }
00598     }
00599     
00600     /* keypad2 to padplus */
00601     char pad2topadplus[] = "246813579. 0- +";
00602     if ((keyIndex >= SCA_IInputDevice::KX_PAD2) 
00603         && (keyIndex <= SCA_IInputDevice::KX_PADPLUSKEY)) { 
00604         return pad2topadplus[keyIndex - SCA_IInputDevice::KX_PAD2];
00605     }
00606 
00607     return '!';
00608 }
00609 
00610 
00611 
00616 bool IsPrintable(int keyIndex)
00617 {
00618     /* only print 
00619      * - numerals: KX_ZEROKEY to KX_NINEKEY
00620      * - alphas:   KX_AKEY to KX_ZKEY. 
00621      * - specials: KX_RETKEY, KX_PADASTERKEY, KX_PADCOMMAKEY to KX_PERIODKEY,
00622      *             KX_TABKEY , KX_SEMICOLONKEY to KX_RIGHTBRACKETKEY, 
00623      *             KX_PAD2 to KX_PADPLUSKEY
00624      * - delete and backspace: also printable in the sense that they modify 
00625      *                         the string
00626      * - retkey: should this be printable?
00627      * - virgule: prints a space... don't know which key that's supposed
00628      *   to be...
00629      */
00630     if ( ((keyIndex >= SCA_IInputDevice::KX_ZEROKEY) 
00631           && (keyIndex <= SCA_IInputDevice::KX_NINEKEY))
00632          || ((keyIndex >= SCA_IInputDevice::KX_AKEY) 
00633              && (keyIndex <= SCA_IInputDevice::KX_ZKEY)) 
00634          || (keyIndex == SCA_IInputDevice::KX_SPACEKEY) 
00635          || (keyIndex == SCA_IInputDevice::KX_RETKEY)
00636          || (keyIndex == SCA_IInputDevice::KX_PADENTER)
00637          || (keyIndex == SCA_IInputDevice::KX_PADASTERKEY) 
00638          || (keyIndex == SCA_IInputDevice::KX_TABKEY) 
00639          || ((keyIndex >= SCA_IInputDevice::KX_COMMAKEY) 
00640              && (keyIndex <= SCA_IInputDevice::KX_PERIODKEY)) 
00641          || ((keyIndex >= SCA_IInputDevice::KX_SEMICOLONKEY) 
00642              && (keyIndex <= SCA_IInputDevice::KX_RIGHTBRACKETKEY)) 
00643          || ((keyIndex >= SCA_IInputDevice::KX_PAD2) 
00644              && (keyIndex <= SCA_IInputDevice::KX_PADPLUSKEY)) 
00645          || (keyIndex == SCA_IInputDevice::KX_DELKEY)
00646          || (keyIndex == SCA_IInputDevice::KX_BACKSPACEKEY)
00647         )
00648     {
00649         return true;
00650     } else {
00651         return false;
00652     }
00653 }
00654 
00658 bool IsDelete(int keyIndex)
00659 {
00660     if ( (keyIndex == SCA_IInputDevice::KX_DELKEY)
00661          || (keyIndex == SCA_IInputDevice::KX_BACKSPACEKEY) ) {
00662         return true;
00663     } else {
00664         return false;
00665     }
00666 }
